Its leaves are elongated and often have a waxy texture, adapted to retain moisture in its native habitat. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that develop into fleshy, edible fruits. Due to its specific ecological requirements, Dorstenia kyimbilaensis is considered a rare and endangered species.
